subject: probability
title: Independence of Events
contentHtml: In probability theory, two events are said to be independent if the occurrence of one event does not affect the probability of the other event.
name: Independence Formula" },
proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the conditional probability of A given B is equal to the unconditional probability of A, regardless of the value of B." },
intuition: Intuitively, independence means that knowing one event occurred does not change our belief in the other event. This is useful in machine learning when modeling complex systems.
realWorldApplications: In natural language processing, independent events can represent different sentences or documents.
